column1: length ball on off stump, no swing just yet, Kohli gets across and clips to midwicket
shortish, too much width, and Kohli easily slaps it away to the right of backward point

back of a length, a tiny bit of movement in towards off stump, blocked into the on side. Was looking for the bunted single into the leg side but Sandeep moved quickly in his follow-through to cut it off
overpitched, on the pads, but square leg is on the boundary so Kohli's clip is kept down to one
too full, no swing, lots of room, and Rahul flows into a drive to the left of mid-off
length ball, fifth stump line, no swing at all in the entire over, and Rahul gets forward to push towards point
fullish, a bit of width, driven to cover point
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
length ball, wide-ish, 125kph and there's no pace onto the bat. Looks to slap through point, drags it gently into the covers instead
back of a length, close to off stump, dabbed to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
shortish, close to off stump, no room, dabbed down to third man again
bouncer outside off, Rahul leaves it and the square leg umpire judges the ball rose above head height
back of a length outside off, and there's a tiny bit of shape away to beat Rahul's backfoot punch. No real footwork from him

this time there's a bit more width and he can free his arms to force that away off the back foot, in the air to the left of backward point and the right of third man, and it absolutely hurries to the boundary
back of a length close to off stump, blocked towards point
back of a length, on the pads, clipped to deep square leg

ooh. Length ball outside off, a bit of away movement, and Kohli doesn't move his front foot at all. Just reaches for it away from his body, the bottom hand comes off the handle, and the ball skews in the air but between backward point and cover point

what have you done, Marcus Stoinis? Kohli came down the track, and once again reached away from his body to drive. Ended up slicing it to backward point, at chest height, not too far to his left, and that wasn't a difficult chance at all. Simply bounces out of his palms
back of a length on off stump, worked away through square leg
short, angling down leg. Fine leg is inside the circle and Rahul swivels to put it away to the right of the fielder
short outside off, he hasn't really timed this pull, but he's got it over the infield, and that's enough to take it all the way to the vacant midwicket boundary
down the track, makes himself room, and the ball is just at the right place for a massive carve over extra cover - it carries ten rows back, at least

back of a length outside off, and Rahul is in the zone here. Just lets it come on, and it's almost in the keeper's gloves when he brings his bat down to dab it away with an open face, to the left of short third man
back of a length at the body, tucked away to short fine leg
back of a length, close to off stump. Stops on the pitch a touch and he has to push well in front of his body and hits that punch in the air, for a short duration, to the left of mid-off
back of a length on off stump. Waits on it and dabs to third man
back of a length on off and middle, tucked away to the right of midwicket and Vijay fumbles while bending down to pick up the ball, allowing a second run
back of a length on middle stump, tucks Rahul up for room, and he blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed away to third man
he's stuck to that metronomic length, just back of a length, hovering close to off stump as well, and Kohli goes back and across to punch to midwicket
down the track comes Rahul to his first ball, and his fleet feet take him to the pitch of a ball that has only a hint of flight, and he whips it over wide mid-on
tossed up slower and wider, and Rahul inside-edges the sweep into his pads
down the track again and Axar fires in the straight one. Looks to push into the covers and inside-edges through midwicket instead
back of a length, quickish. Kohli stays leg-side of the ball to punch back to the bowler
fired in at the pads and he clips it away into the leg side, puts pressure on David Miller moving across from deep midwicket and they run two in the end
length ball on off stump. Holds up on the pitch a touch and Kohli pokes it in the air as he checks his drive, but it's safely to the left of the diving Axar, and bounces short of him
slower ball outside off, back of a length. Rahul waits, waits some more, and steers down to third man
back of a length on middle and leg. Again it stops on Kohli, and he flicks it in the air but short of Amla diving left from midwicket
fullish outside off, clipped to long-on
back of a length, angling into leg stump, slower ball. Punched towards mid-on
fullish outside off. He's a little early on this front-foot punch through cover, and checks his shot in the end. Hits the inner part of his bat and goes to midwicket
full-toss wide of off stump, driven to the right of sweeper cover
down the track to the flattish legbreak on the stumps, clips it to long-on
slowish length ball on off stump, pushed quietly to long-off

bowled him! That's a dangerous shot, looking to sweep a stump-to-stump ball. This was a quickish delivery, bowled with a seam-up action, and Rahul went across it and left his middle and leg stump exposed
length ball angling into the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket
legcutter wide of off stump. Kohli throws his bat at it, away from his body, hits it hard, but in the air, and straight to short cover!
slowish leg-roller close to off stump. Watson presses forward and defends
tossed up outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
flat, angling into middle stump, just short of driving length. Pushed to long-on
back of a length, goes with the angle towards leg stump. AB goes on the back foot and punches to long-off

bowled him! Watson is too early into the pull - I've seen this happen before, during the 2013 Test series in India - and Axar's flat, shortish ball holds up on the pitch, keeps just a touch low, and takes out middle and off stumps
tossed up outside off, gets forward for a push into the covers
length ball on middle and off, defended down the pitch
length ball close to off stump, driven towards mid-off
shortish outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, AB plays a checked drive to long-off
back of a length, angling across towards off and middle. Shuffles across to defend, and squeezes it out towards point
back of a length outside off, dabbed to the left of backward point. The throw at the keeper's end misses the stumps, and gives away an overthrow
slower ball on middle and leg. Stays on the back foot, and tucks it towards square leg
fired in on a fullish length on off and middle, clipped away through square leg
back of a length, not as short as AB thinks it is as he goes back to cut. Slides on with the angle, cramps him. AB tries to adjust and whip into the leg side, ends up inside-edging into his back pad
tucked up for room again, punches to short extra cover
fuller now, on leg stump, driven inside-out to the left of long-off
back of a length, going with the angle towards middle and leg. Opens up and whips through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to poke it to the left of cover
back of a length, angling into the pads, worked away to the right of deep backward square leg
slowish legbreak outside off, AB eases it to the left of sweeper cover
tossed up on leg stump, flicked away towards deep midwicket
legbreak floated wide of off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off. Bottom hand takes over as he aims a cover drive at the ball and he ends up dragging it back to the bowler
quickish ball on leg stump. Baby shuffles across to help it towards short fine leg
slower ball, angling across Baby. Shuffles across to nudge it into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, another slower ball, punched down to long-on
slower ball on off stump, stops on Baby, and he scoops it in the air over the bowler, bounces down to long-on
short and wide, and though that's a slower ball, and though he has protection on the cover point boundary, AB can still slap it away fiercely to the right of the desperately sprawled fielder
slower ball on off stump, fuller this time, and AB gets forward to sweep to short fine leg
slower ball on the pads, clipped to the left of deep square leg
full and quick on middle and leg, driven to long-off
slow, loopy full-toss outside off, punched to long-off
stays back to a length ball on middle stump and shows it the full face to punch to long-off
shortish on off stump, makes room and slaps it away to the right of long-off
tossed up on off stump and Baby sweeps powerfully but close enough to Axar, who moves to his left from deep midwicket and stops the ball with a bit of a tumble and a fumble
back of a length, seam-up delivery angling away from off stump. Baby looks to stab it through point and is beaten by the angle and extra pace
flat length ball sliding on to middle stump. AB makes a bit of room to push through cover point
flat, shortish, fairly wide outside off, slapped to the left of sweeper cover
flat length ball angling away from off stump. Baby goes down quickly on one knee and drags that slog-sweep from outside off stump to beat deep midwicket running to his right
another. This time he sweeps from a middle-stump line, hits it squarer, to the left of deep midwicket
length ball on middle and leg. Goes on the back foot, makes some room, and punches to long-off
tossed up full on middle and off, whipped away to deep midwicket, where the busy Miller fumbles an easy pick-up
very full on middle stump, a bit of late swing into the batsman, clipped to long-on
shortish outside off, slapped away to the left of deep point
looks for the yorker, and that's a pretty good ball, but AB walks across, gets down low, meets it on the full to sweep it over the backward square leg boundary
in the blockhole on middle and leg, jabbed down to long-on. Ball rolled slowly enough to the fielder for the batsmen to hurry through for a second
makes a lot of room, exposes all his stumps, and the short ball - it was a short ball on the stumps - is flat-batted crisply over extra cover
full on middle stump, makes room again to drive towards sweeper cover
slower ball, shortish, close to off stump. Makes room and swats it in the air, but in the gap to the left of extra cover
inswinging yorker on off stump, stabbed away towards sweeper cover

slower ball, back of a length. Makes a lot of room and chops it down into the off side. Mohit sprints to his left in his follow-through, dives, and gets a hand to the ball, but can't hold on. Behardien runs in from long-off, and throws at the bowler's end, and Baby dives to complete the second. Not sure he was in if that was a direct hit

another slower ball, and it wasn't a bad ball by any means, it was on off stump. AB makes room again, moves away from leg stump and then stands nice and still, makes himself a stable base, and uses the swinging room he's created to flat-bat it back over the bowler's head
another slower ball, and AB is down on his knee in a flash to play a wristy sweep, just whips that to the square leg boundary to bring up a vital half-century
slower short ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
AB was just beginning to move away from leg stump, and Sandeep looked to follow him. Ends up bowling a loopy, slow full-toss, and AB swishes it away over the backward square leg boundary
oh my. He's just not getting the yorkers right. Ends up bowling a full-toss outside off, and AB flat-bats it over the covers, and it runs away quickly to the boundary to the left of long-off
short ball outside off, and AB is surprised a little. A little late on his pull, and ends up chopping the ball down into the off side
full-toss on off stump, clears his front leg and clubs it down to long-on
gone. That's the wide yorker, and AB looks to steer that wide of short third man. Makes a bit of room, slices it away with an open bat face, middles it perfectly, and picks out the fielder
wide-ish slower ball outside off, back of a length. No footwork from Head, just stands and slashes, and he can't connect
shortish slower ball, and Baby swivels and times the pull really well. Anureet has to sprint quickly to his left from deep backward square leg and dive to cut off the boundary
sees him make room and follows him with a low full-toss. Jams his bat down and squeezes it out into the leg side
follows his movement away from leg stump with a yorker, and Baby can't connect with the flick. The ball shoots between his legs

Mohit isn't amused. He bowled another yorker outside leg stump, and the batsman cleared his front leg to be able to flick it. The ball clipped the outside of his pad through to the keeper, and Dharmasena signals wide
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
low full-toss on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
another yorker outside leg, another wide signalled. This time Baby missed the flick and the ball missed his pad as well
yorker on middle and leg, whipped away through square leg
reaches out to the wide yorker and slaps it to the right of extra cover. Vijay dives to stop it, gets a hand to the ball, and lets it roll away from him to give away a second
low full-toss wide of off, Head reaches out, scoops it in the air, but on the bounce to long-off
wide yorker again, a little too wide. Only way Head could have reached that would have been if he'd dived
shot! That isn't the worst ball, it's very full, angling into off stump, and he clears his front leg and uses his wrists to whip it back over the bowler's head
full and wide outside off, gets down low to slap it away towards sweeper cover

what a catch that is! Length ball, and Head looks to hit across it, clearing his front leg and aiming over midwicket. The ball isn't quite as full as he'd like, and because he's going at it with a diagonal bat, it means he hits it off the outside half of it, slices it in the air, and Vijay, running towards the boundary from short extra cover, does brilliantly to take it while it drops from behind him, while running at full tilt
full again, chipped towards long-on. They go for the second, it's the last ball after all, and Baby is nowhere near the crease when Saha picks up Miller's throw and removes the bails
Starts with a short ball close to off stump and Amla shuffles across to nurdle it into the leg side
length ball outside off, just a bit of outswing. Vijay pokes it gently into the cover point region
back of a length close to off stump, Amla gets behind it and pokes it back towards the bowler
full outswinger outside off, driven to deep point. Interesting choice to have him back on the boundary, but Amla is very strong in that area
full outside off, whipped to mid-on, who's on the edge of the circle
shortish outside off. Amla walks across to work it to deep square leg
starts with a flat one sliding down the leg side, and Amla just tickles it away to the right of short fine leg
back of a length on leg stump, goes deep in his crease to work it to the right of midwicket
full, sliding down leg. Vijay plays for turn, looking for the clip through the leg side, and the ball beats his inside edge and hits his pad
once again sliding down leg. Cab't put bat to the flick, and it hits the outside of his pad and rolls to short fine leg
back of a length, looks like the googly. Amla went back to punch through the off side, and he's forced to defend as it cramps him for room
back of a length on off stump, whipped towards mid-on
starts with a bouncer over off stump, pulled away to long leg
short, wide, and Vijay stands tall and uses the pace to simply lift it over point
short again, and this one angles far down the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to deep square leg
short outside off, Amla uses his wrists to flay that to the left of backward point, down to the man at third man
short, angling in to off stump, and Vijay opens up quickly to pull this over midwicket
fullish, close to off stump. Vijay doesn't really move forward to this, instead uses his wrists to whip that between the bowler and the stumps, a la VVS
slower ball on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
down the track comes Vijay, and Binny achieves a bit of outswing, making Vijay slice his attempted loft over mid-off high over point instead. Falls safely enough
back of a length slower ball outside off, dabbed towards short third man
slower bouncer, and Anil Chaudhary signals wide after Vijay just stands there and lets it balloon to the keeper
back of a length outside off, steered to deep point
back of a length on off stump, flat-batted wristily to mid-off, who's deep enough to allow the single
full outside off, and Vijay goes back and across, deep in his crease, and uses his wrists to whip it wide of mid-on
tossed up on leg stump, and Amla whips it in the air, doesn't middle it, and it falls short of mid-on
shortish outside off, and Amla isn't too balanced as he tries to slap it away through point. Extra bounce beats him
back of a length, slides on to cramp Amla, who plays a short-arm jab to mid-on
a bit of flight onto leg stump. Vijay is too early into his sweep, he misses it, and it rolls off his pad towards short fine leg
short, just a bit of width, and Amla steps away to make just a bit more room to slice it up and over point

fired in quicker, angling down leg. Amla is late getting down to sweep, and it ricochets off his pad into the off side of the pitch. They set off for the leg bye, and Chahal gets to the ball quickly, spins around even quicker, and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end. It's gone up to the third umpire, and it looks like Amla has juuust made it
shortish slower ball outside off, pulled away to the left of deep square leg
short outside off, and Amla stabs it away crisply, but too close to Head at backward point
short, Amla has to fetch the pull from a long way outside off, and he doesn't get any real power into it. Binny times his jump perfectly at midwicket, takes it with both hands over his head
back of a length on off stump, steered down to third man
length ball close to off stump, just a bit of away movement to beat Vijay's attempt at a cute steer to third man
back of a length, just a bit of width, and Vijay lets it come on and rolls his wrists over at the top of the bounce to split the gap between backward point and short third man
short outside off, and Saha chops it away nicely to the backward point boundary. A little too much width, and all Saha had to do was use the pace
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length, close to off stump, steered to backward point
bouncer, and Vijay leans away from the line of it
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg
shortish, close to off stump. Saha plays his favourite dab to third man again
tossed up on middle and off. No footwork from Saha, just pushes at it with his hands, and it turns and skews off the outside half of his bat through point
length ball on middle stump, and Vijay clips it quietly through square leg, and uses the long boundary on that side to pick up two
back of a length on leg stump, whipped away to the right of long-on
back of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
tossed up close to off stump, pushed down to long-off
back of a length on leg stump, Vijay brings out the topspin whip again, down to long-on
down the track, making himself some room, and Aaron sees him coming, bowls a wide-ish slower ball that he can't quite connect with as he reaches out
back of a length on leg stump, glanced to fine leg
back of a length on middle stump, uses his wrists to work it down to fine leg
shortish outside off, Vijay is a little late on the pull, and ends up toe-ending it to mid-off
short again, angling into the batsman this time, and that is a superb shot, swivelled on his back leg to hook it over the backward square leg boundary
length ball on off stump. Vijay is a little early on the drive, and his bottom hand takes over as he ends up playing it down through mid-on rather than extra cover as intended
pressure on the bowler, boundary off the first ball of the over. Down the track, gets inside the line, and positions himself just right for the chip over extra cover
fullish on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
down the track, clips this from outside off stump towards long-on
down the track again and he fires it in quicker and shorter, tucking up the batsman by bowling at his legs. Clipped down to long-on
tossed up wide of off, steered to backward point
fired in at the pads, clipped into the leg side and they run two easily with Kohli having to come in two-thirds of the way from deep midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, Vijay drags the sweep to short fine leg off the bottom edge
short outside off, pulled to the right of long-on
not that short outside off, but he goes back and stabs to point, and takes on Head's arm for the quick single. Throw at the bowler's end misses
short, wide, slapped to the left of sweeper cover

down the track, and has Rahul missed another stumping? Lovely flight, a bit of dip, and Saha ends up playing all around the ball as he looks to work it against the turn. Saha is a long way down the pitch, but Rahul doesn't catch cleanly. It hits his pad and he has to pick it up off the ground to complete the stumping. Saha turns around and stretches back into the crease, but it looks like the bails are off by the time he makes it. But the third umpire wants to see this again - the ball has bounced up off his pad and it's bounced down off the grille of his helmet. But he clarifies that since the ball hasn't bounced directly onto the stumps off the helmet, and that he picked it up with his glove in between, it's fine

gone! That is a beautiful delivery! This time Rahul makes no mistake. Angles it across Miller, outside off stump, and he comes forward and reaches out to drive. The ball doesn't turn as much as he expects, and it beats his outside edge and Rahul whips off the bails with Miller having dragged his back foot out of the crease
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, steps across to clip to deep square leg
slower bouncer outside off, Vijay can't connect with the attempted lean-back-and-ramp-over-the-keeper
excellent delivery, a bit of late inswing on that off-stump yorker. Vijay looks to poke it away into the off side, ends up jabbing towards mid-on off the inside edge
back of a length on middle stump, shows the full face to push down to long-on
fullish outside off, Vijay gets forward and whips to long-on to bring up his half-century
back of a length, a bit of width outside off. Vijay steps forward, clearing his front leg a touch, and lofts it smoothly over mid-off
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
length ball outside off, driven to mid-off. Looked like he was trying to hit through the covers but dragged it a bit
shortish, angling into the body, Stoinis plays a short-arm jab out to deep square leg
full on middle and leg, and Vijay has whipped that away brilliantly. Square leg had just come into the circle, and he puts it away to the right of the fielder
fullish wide of off, driven to sweeper cover
fullish, angling down leg. Plays for the turn, looking to whip into the leg side, but there is none, and it slides through and ricochets off the front pad into the off side
back of a length on off stump and Abdulla dives to his right to stop the attempted whip to long-on
length ball wide of off, stabbed away to sweeper cover
wide length ball and Vijay tries to reach out for the flat-bat loft over the covers, ends up cue-ending it wide of the keeper and it runs away to the third man boundary
bang. A big step down the pitch, and he's right up to the pitch of this leg-stump ball to whip it over the bowler's head
slows it down, back of a length, angling down leg. Goes back to whip into the leg side, but he's too early into the shot, and the ball hits him on the pad
back of a length angling down leg, clipped away fine but there's a man on the fine leg boundary to stop it
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and eases it away towards deep point

full on off stump and he looks to shuffle across and whip it wide of square leg. Ends up hitting it straight to the fielder. Stoinis had run out of his crease, looking for the single, and a direct hit at his end would have found him well short
shortish slower ball on off stump, and Vijay makes room to scoop it into the gap to the left of long-off

low full-toss close to off stump, and Vijay makes room to slice it away to the right of a diving backward point fielder. Jordan, the sweeper, covers a lot of ground to his left, quickly, but ends up fumbling on the dive and pushing the ball onto the rope
slower ball, back of a length and fairly wide outside off. Vijay looks to steer it away through point, can't put bat to ball. He lets out an angry yell after he misses the ball
quickish length ball on leg stump. Stoinis goes deep in his crease to whip towards deep square leg
down the leg side again, and Vijay steps across and puts it away with a whip-pull to the left of short fine leg
back of a length googly, flicked away to deep midwicket
down the track and he shortens his length. Just shows the full face to push to long-on
back of a length, on middle stump, not a bad ball at all. Vijay switches his hands on the handle, steps away from leg (off) stump, and swats it away fine, to the third man (fine leg) boundary
length ball on the pads, stays on the back foot to flick through midwicket
slower short ball outside off, Stoinis can't connect with his cut
short outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
full outside off, and Vijay lofts it over extra cover. Bounces down in the gap between sweeper cover and long-off. The former, true to his name, does the sweeping up
short outside off, Vijay looks to make room and slap it away. Can't put bat to ball. His weight was moving away from the ball as he played the shot
ooh, that was close. Sees Vijay making a bit of room and spears it wide of off - that seemed right over the tramline. Dharmasena doesn't signal wide

short ball gets the big wicket. Given the size of the square boundary, it's pretty difficult to drag the pull from wide of off stump, and he can only hit it as far as Chahal on the square leg boundary

short and wide, and Head has made a mess of this on the boundary. Slapped away fiercely to the right of backward point, and Head, running to his left on the boundary, can't make a routine diving stop, lets it slip under him. Pretty good first ball in the IPL for Behardien
full-toss on the stumps, shows the full face to push to long-on
low full-toss on middle stump, whipped to long-on
full-toss outside off, and Behardien punches it away to the right of the diving extra cover fielder. AB moves quickly to his left from long-off and cuts it off
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
shot! Full, angling into leg stump, and Stoinis steps across smartly, sinks down low, and uses the pace to scoop it over short fine leg
fullish, close to off stump, beats the bat as Behardien tries to loft that inside-out over the covers
bouncer, angling into the batsman and cramping him for room. Hooks weakly in the air, falls well short of deep square leg
full-toss wide of off stump, that's a horrible delivery, and Stoinis sinks low and slashes it away to the right of backward point and a long way to the left of sweeper cover
slower bouncer, and Stoinis, leaning back, can't connect with the attempted ramp over the keeper
length ball on off stump, swiped down to long-on. Didn't middle it at all
yorker on middle stump, clears his front leg and drives to long-off. End of an excellent, possibly match-winning spell from Watson

full-toss on the pads, and he whips it away but too close to deep square leg. Chahal moved quickly to his right, too quickly, and almost overran the ball, had to stop and reach out against his momentum to stop the ball
full on leg stump, and that is smashed. Makes himself room and uses his hands and wrists brilliantly to drive that to the left of extra cover with a lot of power
down the track and this is a length ball, stays inside the line and lofts it over the long-off boundary, he's just cleared the rope. Phew!
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Stoinis was shaping to shuffle across and scoop. Changes his mind to stab through the off side, but by then it's too late. Beaten!
full-toss on off stump and he makes room to slap to the left of sweeper cover and pick up two. He didn't time it at all, and his top hand came off the handle, but he keeps strike

full-toss on off stump and all he can do is pull to deep midwicket and pick up two. That was quick, and he didn't have enough swinging room to get any power on the shot. Royal Challengers win by one run.
